title: How to Solve a Sudoku with Your Android Camera

parts.name: Downloading and Installing Sudoku Solver Master

steps.headline: Tap on the Play Store icon on the device home screen or application drawer.
steps.description: This will launch the app. The Play Store icon looks like a small white bag with a play symbol in the middle.

steps.headline: Search for Sudoku Solver Master.
steps.description: Tap the magnifying glass in the upper right-hand side of the screen. Type in “Sudoku Solver Master,” with no quotes, and hit the magnifying glass at the bottom right-hand side of the on-screen keyboard to proceed with the search.

steps.headline: Install Sudoku Solver Master.
steps.description: The first search result at the top of the page should be a small square with a 9, 0, and 1, and a little camera icon inside of a white box. In the upper right-hand corner of the box should be 3 dots rising vertically. Tap the 3 dots. A small box will appear that says “Install”; tap it, and a Permissions page will appear. Tap on “Accept,” and the installation process will begin.

parts.name: Using Sudoku Solver Master to Solve Any Sudoku Puzzle

steps.headline: Start a Sudoko puzzle.
steps.description: There are several sources from where you can get a Sudoko puzzle: a Sudoko puzzle book, the newspaper, and even online.

steps.headline: Tap on Sudoku Solver Master from your app drawer or home screen.
steps.description: This will launch the camera using the app.

steps.headline: Take a picture of the puzzle.
steps.description: Aim the camera at the puzzle, and make sure to hold it still. Tap the screen to take a picture of the puzzle. There should be a camera shutter sound.

steps.headline: Solve the puzzle.
steps.description:
Once the picture is taken, a white screen should appear with the picture of the puzzle that was just taken in the upper left-hand side of the screen. There should be two buttons under the puzzle: “Solve” and “Web Search: Sudoku Puzzle.”
Tap “Solve” and a bigger picture of the Sudoku puzzle will appear on the screen. Blue numbers should fill the empty boxes of the puzzle. The puzzle is now solved! The black numbers are the ones that were taken of the original puzzle.

text:
Downloading and Installing Sudoku Solver Master Tap on the Play Store icon on the device home screen or application drawer. This will launch the app. The Play Store icon looks like a small white bag with a play symbol in the middle. Search for Sudoku Solver Master. Tap the magnifying glass in the upper right-hand side of the screen. Type in “Sudoku Solver Master,” with no quotes, and hit the magnifying glass at the bottom right-hand side of the on-screen keyboard to proceed with the search. Install Sudoku Solver Master. The first search result at the top of the page should be a small square with a 9, 0, and 1, and a little camera icon inside of a white box. In the upper right-hand corner of the box should be 3 dots rising vertically. Tap the 3 dots. A small box will appear that says “Install”; tap it, and a Permissions page will appear. Tap on “Accept,” and the installation process will begin. Using Sudoku Solver Master to Solve Any Sudoku Puzzle Start a Sudoko puzzle. There are several sources from where you can get a Sudoko puzzle: a Sudoko puzzle book, the newspaper, and even online. Tap on Sudoku Solver Master from your app drawer or home screen. This will launch the camera using the app. Take a picture of the puzzle. Aim the camera at the puzzle, and make sure to hold it still. Tap the screen to take a picture of the puzzle. There should be a camera shutter sound. Solve the puzzle. Once the picture is taken, a white screen should appear with the picture of the puzzle that was just taken in the upper left-hand side of the screen. There should be two buttons under the puzzle: “Solve” and “Web Search: Sudoku Puzzle.”
Tap “Solve” and a bigger picture of the Sudoku puzzle will appear on the screen. Blue numbers should fill the empty boxes of the puzzle. The puzzle is now solved! The black numbers are the ones that were taken of the original puzzle.
